jwiki.util

Class FString

  • java.lang.Object
    • jwiki.util.FString

  • public final class FString
extends Object
    Frequently used, static String functions.
    Author:
    Fastily

    • Method Detail

      • inputStreamToString

        public static String inputStreamToString(InputStream is)
        Reads contents of an InputStream to a String.
        Parameters:
        is - The InputStream to read into a String
        Returns:
        The String we made from the InputStream, or the empty String if something went wrong.

      • toCaps

        public static String toCaps(String s)
        Capitalizes the first character of a String. PRECONDITION: s is not null.
        Parameters:
        s - The String to capitalize
        Returns:
        A copy of s, with the first character capitalized.

      • enc

        public static String enc(String s)
        Encodes a UTF-8 String into a format valid for URLs.
        Parameters:
        s - The String to encode
        Returns:
        The encoded String

      • encValues

        public static HashMap<String,String> encValues(HashMap<String,String> hl)
        URL encode each String value in a HashMap. Caveat: This mutates hl.
        Parameters:
        hl - The HashMap to URL encode values for.
        Returns:
        The same HashMap that was passed in for convenience.

      • makeURLParamString

        public static String makeURLParamString(HashMap<String,String> hl)
        Generates a URL parameter String from a HashMap. For example, a HashMap with [(someKey:someValue), (foo:baz)] will result in &someKey=someValue&foo=baz. WARNING: This does not URL encode values.
        Parameters:
        hl - The parameter list to generate a String for.
        Returns:
        The URL parameter String.

      • pipeFence

        public static String pipeFence(String... planks)
        Make a fence with pipe characters as posts.
        Parameters:
        planks - The planks to use, in order.
        Returns:
        A String with the specified planks and pipe characters as posts

      • fenceMaker

        public static String fenceMaker(String post,
                                List<String> planks)
        Concatenate Strings. Solution to the fencepost problem. Makes patterned Strings like "This|So|Much|Easier".
        Parameters:
        post - The String to go between planks. Optional param, use empty string/null to disable. You can (and should) also specify the '%n' operator in order to add new lines.
        planks - The planks of the fence post problem. Posts divide planks.
        Returns:
        The completed fencepost string.
